page.content: { }REPORT FORM THE {ARGYLLSHIRE {ADVRTISER}DATED 25TH MAY 1985. {CHILDREN IN DANGER} FEARS HAVE BEEN RAISED FOR THE SAFETY OF SCHOOL CHILDREN AT KILMICHAEL-GLASSARY PRIMARY SCHOOL. THE MAIN ACCESS TO THE 38 PUPIL SCHOOL OPENS DIRECTLY ON TO THE MAIN ROAD WITH NO VERGE OR PAVEMENT. A PETITION CIRCULATING IN THE AREA SAYS THAT WITH THE RISING SCHOOL ROLL THERE HAVE BEEN SEVERAL NEAR MISSES WHEN YOUNGER CHILDREN HAVE VENTURED ON TO THE ROAD, AND ONE INCIDENT WHEN A CHILD'S BIKE WAS HIT BY A CAR. THE ROAD PAST THE SCHOOL IS ALSO USED BT HEAVY VEHICLES GOING TO AND FROM THE SAWMILL. THE PETITION, WHICH WILL HAVE ABOUT 100 SIGNATURES WILL BE PRESENTED TO THE AUTHORITIES ASKING THEM TO MOVE THE ACCESS TO A SAFER POSITION.
